column1: Why did the teacher put the lights on? because the class was so dim!
column3: In this context, dim means both not bright (referring to light) and not intelligent (referring to a person).
column4: The room was dim when the lights were turned off.
column5: His dim-witted answers to the questions frustrated the teacher.

column1: What type of store doesnt move? a stationary store.
column3: Stationary refers to something that is not moving, while also referring to office supplies such as paper and pens.
column4: The car remained stationary at the traffic light.
column5: I bought some stationary items, including paper and envelopes, for my office.

column1: What do you call an abortion in prague? a cancelled czech.
column3: Czech refers to the nationality and is a play on the word check, which means to cancel something.
column4: He showed his proud Czech heritage during the festival.
column5: Please remember to check your email for updates.

column1: Why did snoop dogg need an umbrella? fo drizzle.
column3: Drizzle refers to light rain as well as the act of pouring a liquid lightly over food (like sauce).
column4: It started to drizzle, so I took out my umbrella.
column5: I like to drizzle olive oil over my salad for extra flavor.
